ETYMOLOGY: Coined in 1891 by Irish physicist George Johnstone Stoney, from 'electric' (referring to electricity, derived from Ancient Greek ἤλεκτρον (ḗlektron, 'amber'), due to early observations of static electricity from rubbing amber) + the suffix '-on' (used for subatomic particles, e.g., proton, neutron).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A stable subatomic particle that has a negative electric charge and is found in all atoms. It is the primary carrier of electricity in solids.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种带负电荷的稳定亚原子粒子，存在于所有原子中。它是固体中电流的主要载体。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Electrons orbit the nucleus of an atom in shells.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 电子以电子层形式围绕原子核运行。
